item.title: AIB 2022
item.description:
Next week I will be participating in the annual Academy of International Business Conference in Miami, which is hosted by Florida International University. The theme this year is ‘Beyond Diversity and Inclusion: Equity and Fairness in International Business’. Thus, there will be ample opportunity to discuss how IB scholars can increasingly integrate Equity and Fairness into IB research and the post-pandemic globalization.

During the conference, I will be presenting some preliminary findings from my research on cross-border e-commerce in European firms, where I explore heterogeneity in managerial perceptions of barriers to cross-border e-commerce across firms, industries, and countries.

This will be the first time since 2019 in Copenhagen where the conference will take place physically.

If you want to read more about the conference you can do so here.

item.title: New research article
item.description:
I’m happy to share a recent publication that I have written together with my colleagues Svetla Marinova, Bozidar Vlacic and Miguel Gonzalez Loureiro which have been accepted for publication in International Business Review and is now available online.

The study is one of few studies that examine the role of business group affiliation on SMEs international sales intensity and diversification in developed economies. The study uses a multi-country sample of over 13,000 European SMEs from 34 different countries to examine under what conditions business group affiliation is beneficial to the international sales of SMEs.

The publication can be downloaded free of charge using the link below:

https://lnkd.in/g3b2YSq8
